Articles.Content:
Hi there,

I might be somekind of blind, but is there somekind of version tracker on the ksp website or in the forum, where non-steam-users might find, if they need to update ksp?

I read that the ARM was already updated again, but I don't know for sure, if I got mine before or after that update.

Right now, I am running 0.23.5.459

Thx for opening my eyes

Most recent download is 0.23.5.464.

Unfortunately, I'm not sure where you can simply find this info without downloading it again.
Not quite what you're looking for, but I've set my browser to monitor http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Version_history for updates.
There's been several hotfixs released. I think Horman is looking to see if the current hotfix version is listed somewhere online.

According to the wiki it should be 0.23.5.464

My Steam copy says 0.23.5.0 on the menu, which confuses me.

For Steam users, take a look in C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.txt

The first line should have the full version in it, including the build number.
In the bottom right corner of the menu screen when you start the game it tells you the version number.

In the bottom right corner of the menu screen when you start the game it tells you the version number.

Yes, I am aware of this - but is there a quicker way to check the version then by starting the game with all my mods?

I am a non-Steam-user
